ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Deepti Chatti  Deepti Chatti
Instructor: Deepti Chatti  Deepti
Instructor: Deepti Chatti  Deepti

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Deepti Chatti  Very helpful for discussing paper topics, insightful comments during class
Instructor: Deepti Chatti  She was great, very insightful, approachable, polite, etc.
Instructor: Deepti Chatti  Deepti was really helpful in giving feedback for my paper. She was very willing to meet outside of class and very clear about how we could improve on assignments.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I enjoyed the professor's lectures and I think the sessions devoted to talking about the progress on our papers helped prepare us.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Readings were very interesting

The course (and paper) was really useful to explore topics relevant for my master's research. The readings were very relevant and I feel like I have a much better understanding of anthropological perspectives of disaster and degradation. The guest speakers were excellent.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Discussion was sometimes slow
I felt some weekly readings were a little less relevant to the course title (such as Linnaeus), but this may just reflect me interest in perspectives of disasters.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The class discussion was always very illuminating, partly because the all the students were engaged and the readings were well chosen.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: The course helps my research for my master's thesis.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I took the course as an opportunity to learn about anthropological perspectives on climate change and disasters. I also used it to advance research on my thesis.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes
Yes, the readings were well chosen and the discussions supplemented the knowledge I gained through the readings.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: For students interested in taking this course in the future -- keep an open mind about the title as the instructor takes a broad approach to "Disasters, Degradation, and Dystopia". This course is a great further step for those who have previously taken a Society & Environment course with Prof. Dove or Carol Carpenter
A lot of reading assigned so readings should be started a week in advance in order to be able to write a response paper in time
I advise starting the paper writing as early as possible.
